column4: Hi, I have a dual booting machine and I can no longer see windows in the bootloader. How can I get it back?
Was that an answer for me?
sudo apt-get install os-prober; sudo os-prober; sudo update-grub
should do it
: many thanks I will try this and let you know of the outcome
This is the output from sudo os-prober.. http://www.wired.com/epicenter/2010/11/the-path-to-social-network-tranquility-is-lined-by-50-friends/
it's really not
please use a pastebin for multiple lines of output
ok then run: sudo update-grub    reboot to test
many thanks for your advice, that worked perfectly. just ouf of interest do you know why this happens? its happened in the past and I just reinstalled the operating systems!
no idea, i just know the fix. i dont use windows or dual boot personally
what was the os-prober you suggested I downloaded?
it scans the disks for OSes and puts them in /etc/grub.d/30_os-prober    afaik
ah ok, then update grub puts the os's back into the grub folder then?
update-grub reads all the grub confi files and eerates grub.cfg
sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree    and you'll haveit
i use lubuntu too, its all I use these days
thanks running that now, there is so much I need to learn about lubuntu, I put it on a SSD and it boots in 15 seconds!
xpud boots in 3
I am just having to google that to see what it is all about, first time I have heard of it!
is xPud worth installing? have you had experience in using it?
it has about 6 apps, torrent client, browser, text editor and a few others, its very minimal and you will have to doa lot of manual config
I think i will give it a go, sounds like a perfect 'instant boot' OS
